title: DPHOR
author: DPHOR
content: The title already sum it up and it's no longer new thing anymore about the market uncontrollable increase. Sincerely right from Bitcoin history and as I have been hearing about bitcoin even before joining the forum, I had never heard of such increase in the market. Though it's no longer news anymore as each and everyone of us here knows it was the emergent of Donald Trump in the US presidential election, which is strongly giving rise to the Bitcoin market and every other coins follows immediately.I have actually made a topic where I saw how the bitcoin price gonna move, but still I want to know because with the way things are going it seems bitcoin wouldn't maintained it's circlic progression anymore. Who knows the plans of Donald Trump and Elon Musk after he might have finally sworn in as president.Do you think bitcoin will maintain its circle as usual?Will there ever be an uncalled dump in the market?Let's give our give our view towards the market to know what possibilities awaits us.

comments.author: Oshosondy
comments.body: It may seem to some people like the market is never going to get full of the bears again or in a way everyone will remain as bulls but that is not true. A time will still come when Donald Trump would be the president of United States that the bulls will become bears while many people will remain bearish which will lead to a bear market. What I do not just know is to what extent of bearishness the market would be.I am not saying bitcoin is not going to surpass $100000. We are still in bull market.

comments.author: pooya87
comments.body: Quote from: DPHOR on November 24, 2024, 06:46:22 AMThough it's no longer news anymore as each and everyone of us here knows it was the emergent of Donald Trump in the US presidential election, which is strongly giving rise to the Bitcoin market and every other coins follows immediately.That is not exactly what happened.In case you've forgotten, bitcoin price was around $38k back in January 2024 and by November it had already risen all the way up to $70k+, then after the US election concluded it went up higher to $90k+ meaning there is already a bigger rise pre US Election.That was just 2024, the previous year (2023) was even better where price went from $15k all the way to $40k (160%).What most people are forgetting these days is that bitcoin has been rising for a long time and even though there are "catalyst" events like the weird Trump hype, the main reason for the long term rise is something else. For example we are currently in the same rise during the old 4-year cycles marked by the 4-year halving where the [new] supply is cut by half.Part of the recent rise was also the lowering of interest rates in a lot of different countries including USA which first alleviated the recession and secondly let the capital go back to other markets including bitcoin.Quote from: DPHOR on November 24, 2024, 06:46:22 AMWho knows the plans of Donald Trump and Elon Musk after he might have finally sworn in as president.It's the same. As much as these things can be positive contributors to the rise, they can be negative contributors are well. But at the end of the day bitcoin rises in the long run because it has a capped supply and an increasing demand.I don't think it is easy to predict what these guys will do. They have given lots of promises that look good on paper but then they are rich people who think about filling their own pockets not to help Bitcoin. We have to wait and see. For all we know Trump and Musk will create a new centralized shitcoin and try to sell that to people instead of Bitcoin and they may even ban bitcoin Chinese style.Quote from: DPHOR on November 24, 2024, 06:46:22 AMWill there ever be an uncalled dump in the market?There will be many unexpected crashes on the way toward the peak. Just go back and analyze the entire price chart for 2017 and see how many ups and downs bitcoin had going from below $1000 all the way to $20000 ATH.

comments.author: Japinat
comments.body: Quote from: DPHOR on November 24, 2024, 06:46:22 AMDo you think bitcoin will maintain its circle as usual?Changes are inevitable with stricter regulations and the influx of institutional investors. Before the approval of ETFs, we’ve seen the market go through extreme volatility time and again, that’s why pump-and-dump schemes thrive.However, the numbers tell the real story. If you look at the graph, you’ll notice that annual volatility percentages have actually been dropping. It’s a sign that the market is maturing, even if the road has been a bit wild so far.https://www.theblock.co/data/crypto-markets/prices/annualized-btc-volatility-30d

comments.author: BIT-BENDER
comments.body: Even if yes the emergence of Donald Trump may have allegedly sparked an increase in the price of Bitcoin I will still stand on the fact that Bitcoin is independent of any one and that includes any politicians. Bitcoin enthusiast has existed even before Donald Trump show friendliness to Bitcoin and would still exists If Donald Trump suddenly shows hate towards Bitcoin.I won't want to categorical say that the market is going to always go up just because Trump is in power, as we all know the market is volatile and can swing either ways. It's also imperative to know that this year was the expected year to bring about the bull run, and alot of events lead to where we are now not only the US general election. A quick advice don't be fully lead by media, or politicians in your crypto-currency they both can easily pass wrong information so long as it favours their interests.

comments.author: franky1
comments.created_time: November 24, 2024, 07:15:02 AMLast edit: November 24, 2024, 07:30:13 AM by franky1
comments.body: the market cycles are still in patternin the 2020 cycle.. the previous ATH was $20kin the 2020 cycle.. the halving occurred im May 2020in the 2020 cycle.. the price surpassed the previous ATH($20k) in december 2020 (7 months after halving) and still in the year 2020the post 2020 ATH occurred in 2021($70k)so lets comparethe 2024 halving occurred in aprilthe price surpassed the previous ATH($70k) in november 2024 (7 months after halving) and still in the year 2024the post 2024 ATH will occur in 2025..as for a correction (dump).. yes there will be a correction after the 2025 ATH, and yes no one can predict(call) the exact day/hour the price will find its peak limit of this cycles ATH, so the correction/dump wont be a known time, thus uncalled..as for vague possible calls for ATH and then correction beginningthe 2016 halving happened in july2016 and the ATH happened in december2017 (1year 5months)the 2020 halving happened in may2020 and the ATH happened in october2021 (1year 5months).. so.. the potential ATH of 2025 can be 17 months(1y 5m) after the april halving of 2024.. meaning ~september 2025

comments.author: Ziskinberg
comments.body: Quote from: DPHOR on November 24, 2024, 06:46:22 AMWill there ever be an uncalled dump in the market?Its possible but I see the chance is already slim compared to what has happened in the history of bitcoin. major dumps in the history are as follows. Exchange hacks (Mt. Gox Breach, FTX Collapse).Regulatory aspects ( China's Ban on bitcoin)And lastly corrections were bitcoin have dropped significantly..  after the 2017 bull run bitcoin dropped $3,200, from $20k ATH. I guess we’ve already gone through all the major news that caused those big dumps, and Bitcoin still survived. Now that the market has been strengthened by regulations, we might still see price dips in the future, but nothing as drastic as the massive dumps we’ve seen in the past. Bitcoin has proven its resilience, and the market is maturing as we are seeing now.

comments.author: Kemarit
comments.body: Quote from: DPHOR on November 24, 2024, 06:46:22 AMDo you think bitcoin will maintain its circle as usual?If you are talking about the market going into cycles? Yes, it's because we have what we call Bitcoin halving. The halving occurs every 210,000 blocks which takes roughly 4 years. So that is written already so it means it will always happen and yeah, as you call, it's going to be cyclical.Quote from: DPHOR on November 24, 2024, 06:46:22 AMWill there ever be an uncalled dump in the market?The dump that you might that you might have been seeing in the seeing is what we call the bear market. And yes, there are people who are going to sell their Bitcoin, no matter what. But in a bear market, the price obviously goes down before hard, and in this cycle, the lowest that we've seen the price is $15,500. But just look at where the price is right now, we are about to hit $100,000.

comments.author: franky1
comments.body: Quote from: Kemarit on November 24, 2024, 07:45:25 AMQuote from: DPHOR on November 24, 2024, 06:46:22 AMWill there ever be an uncalled dump in the market?The dump that you might that you might have been seeing in the seeing is what we call the bear market. And yes, there are people who are going to sell their Bitcoin, no matter what. But in a bear market, the price obviously goes down before hard, and in this cycle, the lowest that we've seen the price is $15,500. But just look at where the price is right now, we are about to hit $100,000.the $15.5k is PREVIOUS cycles low however we are now entering the next cycle because we have passed the recent halvingwith mining cost being alot more and reward being half what it was we should not see market drop to $15k ever again unless something drastic happened to the base cost on the planet of acquiring btc

comments.author: SquirrelJulietGarden
comments.body: Quote from: DPHOR on November 24, 2024, 06:46:22 AMDo you think bitcoin will maintain its circle as usual?So far so good, and yes the cycle repeats.https://charts.bitbo.io/compare-bull-markets/QuoteWill there ever be an uncalled dump in the market?Bitcoin is not a pump and dump coin, it's growth naturally and organically with time. You can see this fact in the market price because Bitcoin price is very sustainable after making its new all time high, price will have corrections but a new higher price level will be maintained than a previous cycle and older cycles too. Trading volume becomes bigger after each market cycle too.If it is a simple pump and dump coin, you will not see all these sustainable growth in price and trading volume.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: I have another measure which is positive news, when it goes for more than 3 months without a single negative news it is time to sell.This is almost the first month with positive news without any negative news.

comments.author: SquirrelJulietGarden
comments.body: Quote from: hugeblack on November 24, 2024, 08:17:32 AMI have another measure which is positive news, when it goes for more than 3 months without a single negative news it is time to sell.This is almost the first month with positive news without any negative news. News in cryptocurrency market is ironic in eyes of people in the market. In bull market, even bad news will be not considered as bad news by the majority. In contrast in bear market, even a positive news can be considered as nothing, not important and sometimes can be understood in a way that used to dump the market.I agree with you that when there are massive positive news in the market for a long time, and there is no bad news, it's time to sell. Another signal to think of exit the market is you suddenly receive many questions about Bitcoin, cryptocurrency, this market like how to join, how to earn money in this market from your relatives, friends, and colleagues, it's time to sell.The market top, euphoria phase will be full of newbies and when you see signals of newbies are joining this market, it's time to seriously consider of exit.

comments.author: Finestream
comments.body: Quote from: SquirrelJulietGarden on November 24, 2024, 09:05:56 AMThe market top, euphoria phase will be full of newbies and when you see signals of newbies are joining this market, it's time to seriously consider of exit.It’s too early to exit. If this increase is tied to Trump’s policies and plans, it could take some time to fully play out since he hasn’t even taken office yet. However, if you want to secure profits, cashing out now wouldn’t be a bad move.For me, though, I’m more focused on how far Bitcoin can rise. Like I said, it’s too early to worry about the bearish side. Let’s ride the hype for now and invest while the trend is still strong.

comments.author: notocactus
comments.body: Quote from: franky1 on November 24, 2024, 07:15:02 AMas for a correction (dump).. yes there will be a correction after the 2025 ATH, and yes no one can predict(call) the exact day/hour the price will find its peak limit of this cycles ATH, so the correction/dump wont be a known time, thus uncalledNo one knows about future and future ATH and corrections of Bitcoin from ATH. We all can look at the past cycles, previous bull runs, drawdowns in bull market, and corrections from ATHs, to make our plans that won't be accurate at all.Are you ready for the Bitcoin bull market? What's your plan? Some ideas for youBitcoin price history, ATHs and bottoms.Bitcoin historical corrections. If there is an update on the chart, it will be more useful, data missing since 2021.Bitcoin: Bull Market Correction Drawdowns

comments.author: Obim34
comments.body: Quote from: DPHOR on November 24, 2024, 06:46:22 AMDo you think bitcoin will maintain its circle as usual?Will there ever be an uncalled dump in the market?Let's give our give our view towards the market to know what possibilities awaits us.Yes, Bitcoin will maintain it's cycle as usual, what we are experiencing now is nothing different from our historical data. If we go back and check, the Q4 of every halving year is always a bullish season for the market. Nothing has changed, same pattern are being followed, we will be having our greatest ATH in 2025 before the market begins it's phases of bearish times, even Trump cannot change the process by making all times bullish, as we enjoy the pump, our minds should also be awaiting a dump.  The dump cycle at which you are worried about is primarily the awaited moment another person is waiting to take advantage, Bitcoin can't cope without having a bearish phase.

comments.author: cryptoaddictchie
comments.body: Quote from: DPHOR on November 24, 2024, 06:46:22 AMDo you think bitcoin will maintain its circle as usual?Will there ever be an uncalled dump in the market?Let's give our give our view towards the market to know what possibilities awaits us.Well to be honest the won of Donald Trump makes bitcoin reaches all time high but it doesnt mean it gomna stays forever bullish. But for now, expect some retracement from usual charting. The marker is comprises of every people such as institutiom, whales, retail and traders so anything is possible.We cant hope for it to be stable at all times.

comments.author: AbuBhakar
comments.body: Quote from: DPHOR on November 24, 2024, 06:46:22 AMDo you think bitcoin will maintain its circle as usual?Will there ever be an uncalled dump in the market?Let's give our give our view towards the market to know what possibilities awaits us.There’s always a correction after a price rally because trader will need to take profit especially those who purchase lower price. It’s abnormal for the price to continuously grow without any correction because it will form a bubble which is not good in general.I think the 90K to 100k price will be the next stable price range right after the correction. I’m positive that dump is imminent in able for the price can continuously grow since it will give way for new investors to enter because only few will be buying at ATH.Trust the process. Bitcoin will grow long term.

comments.author: franky1
comments.body: Quote from: tranthidung on November 24, 2024, 01:41:24 PMQuote from: franky1 on November 24, 2024, 07:15:02 AMas for a correction (dump).. yes there will be a correction after the 2025 ATH, and yes no one can predict(call) the exact day/hour the price will find its peak limit of this cycles ATH, so the correction/dump wont be a known time, thus uncalledNo one knows about future no one can know everything but based on past and CURRENT data we are still in cycle patternno one can know exact hour/day/top price.. but there are a few sure things:unless there is a massive code bug, or a economic crises that causes hashrate cost to fall, bitcoin will continue on a deflation curve meaning costs to mine can continue to go up per cycle, thus causing the markets to be higher per cycle

comments.author: notocactus
comments.body: Quote from: franky1 on November 24, 2024, 02:46:31 PMno one can know everything but based on past and CURRENT data we are still in cycle patternHalving event still works with good effects to trigger Bitcoin bull market and a new market cycle. It's a little odd in this cycle by Bitcoin Spot ETF approvals in January but generally the market cycle repeats well.Quoteno one can know exact hour/day/top price.. but there are a few sure things:unless there is a massive code bug, or a economic crises that causes hashrate cost to fall, bitcoin will continue on a deflation curve meaning costs to mine can continue to go up per cycle, thus causing the markets to be higher per cycleYes, you said the truth. The Bitcoin Inflation vs Time chart, and Equivalent Network Time can support your opinion.How is the 21 million bitcoin cap defined and enforced?Equivalent Network Time.

comments.author: pawanjain
comments.body: Quote from: Oshosondy on November 24, 2024, 06:51:58 AMIt may seem to some people like the market is never going to get full of the bears again or in a way everyone will remain as bulls but that is not true. A time will still come when Donald Trump would be the president of United States that the bulls will become bears while many people will remain bearish which will lead to a bear market. What I do not just know is to what extent of bearishness the market would be.I am not saying bitcoin is not going to surpass $100000. We are still in bull market.One thing that I was wondering is that although bitcoin has been currently following it's cycle, we cannot predict until when it will keep following the cycle.Also, every cycle there was a trigger that triggered the bull cycle and this time it looks like the Trump hype was the trigger.But we cannot say whether we will keep getting certain triggers in every cycle. What if there's no trigger in the next cycle ?
